1�What are you doing here? This is no place for civilians.
1�What are you doing here? This is no place for civilians.
1�What are you doing here? This is no place for civilians.
1�What are you doing here? This is no place for civilians.
1�Greetings. I am 	 of the San d'Orian Provincial Knights.
1�Greetings. I am 	 of the Bastokan Legion.
1�Greetings. I am 	 of the Federation of Windurst.
1�Greetings. I am 	, Campaign Arbiter for the Allied Forces.
1�What can I help you with?Nothing.Performance assessment.New Allied Tags.Temporary items.Union registration.Teleportation.Information on the Allied Campaign.
1�You've already undergone an evaluation for this battle, or had you forgotten?As much as I'd like to, I'm forbidden from providing you with a new set of Allied Taegs until the next battle begins.

�!�I am sorry,  , but your campaign medal has expired. I cannot issue tags to anyone not authorized by the Allied Forces. Return to your nation's capital and speak with a Campaign Evaluation Official.

�!�I am sorry,  , but your campaign medal has expired. I cannot issue tags to anyone not authorized by the Allied Forces. Return to your nation's capital and speak with a Campaign Evaluation Official.
1�Understood. I shall now judge your performance and award the proper remuneration.
1�Understood. I shall prepare a new set of tags for you now.
1�Let me show you the list of items currently available to you.

1�Select a category:Quit.

1�Complete transaction and return to capital?Yes.No.
1�What would you like to know?Nothing. I'm sorry.About performance assessment.About Allied Tags.About temporary items.About Unions.
1�Anyone wearing Allied Tags while participating in a campaign battle will be judged on their overall performance.
1�Soldiers will be evaluated not only on their fighting skills, but also on how much they contribute to the efforts of their allies through means such as healing and enhancing.
1�However, beware that if you leave the area before being assessed, you will be deemed a deserter and will forfeit all rewards earned that day.
1�Also, while there are no immediate penalties for being knocked out, falling in battle will significantly lower the score given to you.
1�When you are ready to receive compensation for your work on the field, return to me and I shall assess your performance and provide you with your payment.
1�That is all.
1�Allied Tags are a special type of identification given to all participants of Allied Campaign battles.
1�There are benefits, as well as drawbacks, to wearing the tags. One of the benefits is that in the case you are knocked out on the battlefield, you will not lose any experience points.
1�However, some of the drawbacks include the inability to improve skills and earn experience points for individual kills, as well as the right to loot fallen enemies.
1�That is all.
1�Temporary items can be purchased in exchange for Allied Notes.
1�There are several different varieties of items, but they all have one thing in common--they can only be used on the battlefield they were issued.
1�It is highly recommended that you first survey a battle's conditions and then select the supplies that you believe will benefit you most.
1�Please remember that all temporary items you carry on your person will be confiscated in the event that you leave the area.
1�That is all.
1�Oh ho! Keen to join a Union, are we?Very well. Listen up and I shall tell you all you need to know.

1�In order to better coordinate Allied efforts against the beastman menace, we have instituted a system of ad hoc tactical regiments called ??Unions.?? With five units to a battlefield, union registration is open to any proven soldier in possession of Allied Tags.
1�In return for their aid in advancing the war effort, union registrants will be eligible to earn a share of the spoils of war.

1�Needless to say, the choicest rewards will be reserved for those unions which make the greatest contributions in combat.Prove your mettle on the field of battle, and you will earn glory for your union, as well as a sizable bounty of your own.

1�Be forewarned that your commitment to your union comes first and foremost.In the aftermath of battle, you will not be permitted to reap rewards from your individual exploits until your union has distributed its plunder.
1�That is all.
1�Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, ?[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.
1�Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?
1�I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.
1�Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.

1�What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.Into the Beast's Maw(pt.1).Into the Beast's Maw(pt.2).Into the Beast's Maw(pt.3).Into the Beast's Maw(pt.4).The Hunter Ensnared.Darkness Descends.The Truth Lies Hid.Bonds of Mythril.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Now, listen close...
1�Sir Ragelise! There's something you should see!
1�Wh-what was that?
1�Portia! Sir Ragelise!
1�Wh-what should we do?
t.�<Gasp>! Th-this is--!?
1�Sir Ragelise! Be careful!
1�Sir Ragelise!
1�This is the strike force. Do you copy?
1�Make it so.
!!�So it begins...
1�The enemy is preoccupied with the frontal assault! Now's our chance!
1�I've come to reclaim my woman, demon.If you've a grievance, you may take it up with my blade.
1�It couldn't be...
1�M-my wish? I... I...
1�P-Portia, no... You mustn't...
1�I'm in your debt...
1�Forgive me my forthrightness, but we haven't the time to listen to your happy reminiscences.
1�We came here for no other purpose than to learn the identity of that mysterious entity...the source of its power.What can you tell us?
1�I have naught left to lose.
1�A prophecy...?
1�The entire keep, deserted?Curses! We've played right into their hands!
1�With the bulk of our manpower allocated to the strike force, the Ironcrest Hawks don't stand a chance!
1�Understood!
1�What...in the name...of the Goddess?
1�Those flames...forbidding and cold...
1�What...is this...sensation?
1�?6????...Use it...to tell those stationed without...of our plight!
1�With any luck...reinforcements will be dispatched!
1�But...why?
1�Don't hurt them! Leave them be!
1�I surrendered myself in exchange for the promise that everyone would be spared. Was that but a lie?
1�Then I have no other choice...
1�Lilisette...  ...
1�Sir Ragelise...
1�Thank you...for everything...
1�Thank you...
1�You spoke of a way we could live still, and continue fighting in spite of the curse.
1�I beg you. If there truly is a way, please share it with him...with us.
1�Familiar, yet unlike the one I heard growing up.
1�When the Harbinger cometh,The Champions of the Dawn shall descend.With wings divine in radiance blessed,The eternal night is end.
1�Ragelise! We've conducted a full sweep of the keep, but the place is utterly devoid of enemies.
1�There's not a trace of the Shadow Lord.
1�Once outside, rejoin the San d'Orian forces! They should yet be near!
1�No thanks are required. I merely perform my duty.
1�Coward...
1�Very good. Let us quit this place and bolster the rearguard.
1�Fall in!
1�All unith in the thtrike forthe have withdrawn! You're the only oneth left!
!?�You have entertained our guests well, Count Bifrons.
1�I am here to collect the bait.
1�Your spirit far exceeds your ailing flesh.
1�You would end your own life?
!?�What is it now?
1�Nobody leaves!
1�I shall gift you your lives for now. You would be imprudent to appear before me again.
1�Why, Sir Ragelise! I had been under the impression you were partaking in the diversion.
1�All units, withdraw! I repeat! Withdraw!
1�Such unholy strength!
1�Th-this is the true power of the Shadow Lord!?
1�Ragelise, do you read?We're being overwhelmed! Withdraw at once!
1�They come!
s!�Fire at will!!!
1�The commotion out front feels all too contrived. I smell a plot.
1�A commendable performance.
1�There is nary a truer saying. Do you not agree?
1�You two have overindulged in our hospitality.
1�If I might hazard a guess, the Throne Room would be a probable location. A likely candidate.
1�When I assumed the mantle of being Vana'diel's custodian.
1�The hair ornament you gave to me, Mother. Ever since that day I have always kept it close, that I might never lose sight of my purpose nor let dwindle my inner rage.
1�When the Harbinger cometh,The Maiden of the Dusk shall descend.
1�With wings to bear in crimson steeped,On high the world she tends.
1�Naturally. For the prophecy I recited is not of your future, but mine.
1�The time has come for me to reveal all.
1�The tale of two futures, and those who would arise to champion the survival of each.
1�Ah, there you are,  .I was starting to get worried about you.
1�Seems we're not the only cloak-and-dagger outfit in these parts.Perhaps they have some information to share.
1�Tall, with auburn hair...and imposingly armed when last we saw her.
1�<Ahem>I'll warn you but once: concealing information from us may prove hazardous to your health.
1�What's this? There are others of your ilk here?
1�The castle keep is fraught with dangers.Should you find the opposition to be more than you can handle, return to the baileys and regroup.
1� ! Thank the Goddess you're safe.
1�If you can make any sense of what happened back in that chamber, you've a better head on your shoulders than I.
r.�What dark forces are at play here? Whatever have they done with our Captain Klara?
1�What!? Have you taken leave of your senses, Zeid?
1�Zeid...there's something you haven't told us, isn't there?
1�Whatever burden it is you bear, why not share it?
1�So this is the bond that you and the captain share...
1�And light is shed on the identity of our netherworldly friend as well.
1�Marquis Amon... Six years ago, he sought to lure Zeid to the path of shadow.What foulness could he be plotting this time?
1�And that gem...
1�The captain was caught in its unholy radiance.Could this be how she fell under the monster's spell?
1�In any event, we won't be finding our answers here.
1�Come,  , Zeid, we must return to that chamber!Whatever secrets are to be had, they await us there.
1�The danger is too great, and the matter a personal one.You need not involve yourselves any further.
1�You have fought at our side through many a battle.Time after time, you have come to our aid.
1�Now I ask you: why?What is it that drives you to make the sacrifice you do, with no promise of reward?
1�I see...So we are not the only ones who've reaped the benefits of your aid.
1�I see...To come this far without faltering in your step, your dedication to seeking the truth must be strong indeed.
1�I see...So it is an unwavering desire to see peace restored to this war-torn realm that's brought you this far.
1�There's a strength, a passion in your words.I am reminded of...
1�It was some six years ago.Sent into a mindless rage by the loss of my comrades in the Thirteenth Brigade, I had transformed into little more than a wanton killing machine.
1�Vengeance.Only through vengeance could the pride of my fallen Galkan brothers be restored.
1�I will not lie to you, friends.By that time, Darksteel Hurricane knew not for what end he wielded his grisly blade.
t.�Very well, then.Let us see what the shifty little devil knows.
1�Why, it would be my pleasure, my vertically challenged friend...Right after you tell us what we need to know, that is.
a!�I suspect he's telling the truth...for once.It seems we've no recourse but to seek out his cronies.
1�Ah, right you are.Here, I've just the spell for you.
1�Let's not write him off so quickly, Nicolaus.I'm sure he just needs the proper...encouragement.
1�Grrrrrr... I swear, no sooner ya kill one o' these fiends than one o' their buddies slitherrrs in t' take its place.
1�We can ill afford to engage the grunts one by one.Incapacitate them quickly and falter not in your advance!
e?�Stay your advance, foul--!Wait...you are not foes. Who are you, and what brings you to these disagreeable environs?
1�A passage, you say?
1�Is this the entrance we seek, or merely a snare laid by our foe?The game is afoot...
1�Captain Allenberge, sir! We've come upon a hidden passage above!Behind the stone structure in the northeast chamber!
1�Oh, so we gots ourselves a wise guy, eh? Well, I ain't seen no red-headed Hume broad.So if you ain't gonna unbind me, why don't you just make like a treant and leave?
1�Wh-whoa there, Mister Bandana Man!Flap can't talk about what Flap ain't seen, y'know?
1�Yeah, that's right. Maybe ya've seen 'em around?Like me, only a bit more pallid and sickly-like. The boss don't let 'em outside much, ya see...
1�Now ya done did it, Flap.Sold out yer buddies without even a single lousy beastcoin t' show fer it.
1�I am Captain Klara Bester of the Republic of Bastok's Mythril Musketeers...and I have come to bring this man to justice.
1�I think not, monster.
1�Marquis Amon... So you're the one who lured the brave soldiers of the Thirteenth to their destruction, deceiving their sole survivor and twisting his heart for your own nefarious ends.
1�You're every bit the coward I expected, ??Your Excellency.??
1�Enough! I came for my countryman, not your empty bluster.
1�Wh-what the!?
1�Listen to me! It isn't too late to redeem yourself!You need not torture yourself any longer!
1�Open your eyes, Zeid!!!Remember who you once were! Remember those who believed in you!
1�He lies...
1�Trust me...trust yourself!Take my hand!
1�Take my hand, Zeid!
1�...Thank you. I am fine.
1�I thought we were finished for certain.You have my gratitude.
1�Now, Zeid, I return to the Republic...and you shall come with me.I hereby place you under my personal protection.
1�The crimes you have committed are heinous.Were I to arrest you here, you would see the headsman's block before the week is through.
1�But I have no intention of granting you the sweet release of death.
1�No, Zeid, you will live.You will face your countrymen, your former comrades, and think long and hard about the irreparable wounds you inflicted upon them...and upon yourself.
1�Whether you find solace or despair at the end of your journey, that depends on you alone.This is my justice.
1�I knew it was only a matter of time...War Cloud.
1�Or shall I call you Zeid?I do so hate to stand on formalities with a brother in arms. Heh heh heh...
1�Not very social today, are we?Or has the beast lived in the wild so long that he no longer speaks the mortal tongue?
1�You disappoint me, Zeid. Where has your rage gone?Have you so soon forgotten your vow of vengeance against the wretched Humes who consigned your comrades to their doom?
1�Yes...you are disillusioned with yourself.You could never have foreseen the anger and hatred that fueled you would fade so quickly.
1�But it matters little.In the end, you are naught but a puppet on this grand stage--one that has already performed his role quite admirably.
1�O, wretched child of Altana.This world holds nothing more for you.
1�Your path from here is the path of darkness.Swear allegiance to the Shadow Lord, and you will know power beyond your wildest dreams...and most terrible nightmares.
1�...A woman?Begone, peon. This does not concern you.
1�Oho. The mortal is sharp of mind and tongue...a worthier foe than we gave her credit for.All the more satisfying it will be to crush you--
1�The peasant woman would dare give orders to nobility?Perhaps she is not nearly as wise as we gave her credit for...
1�I have neither the time nor interest to entertain you any further.Stand aside and be silent, as befits your station.
1�The flames of the underworld.I'd suggest you keep a wide berth if you care to prolong your worthless life.
1�This woman cares nothing for you! She seeks only to see a noose tied around your neck.Pay no heed to her deceitful words.
1�The Hume speaks in lies and platitudes, as do all her kind.Place your trust in her, and she will repay you with betrayal in a heartbeat.You know this all too well--don't you, Zeid?
1�Come with me to a world where power--and only power--rules.It is clear where you belong!

1�Be not deceived! The man you once were is lost forever!You are a brutal killer, and nothing more! Nobody cares for you...nobody believes in you...And so it will be for the rest of your miserable life!
1�So quick to throw your life away, woman?Gwahahahahahaha!
1�Sir Noillurie, the perimeter is secure.All our troops have been confirmed evacuated.
1�Yes, ma'a
1�What was that!?
1�Only party members present with you in this area will be transported to  �[Everbloom Hollow/the Ruhotz Silvermines/Ghoyu's Reverie].
1�Proceed?Yes.No.
g.�Your request for entry is being considered.
1�Now entering  �[Everbloom Hollow/the Ruhotz Silvermines/Ghoyu's Reverie

 hour?[/s] of fighting you've accrued.
1�Accept the reward?Yes, please.No, thanks.
1�You cannot obtain the #????.Come back after sorting your inventory.
